meanings.definition: Having a greater amount of nap or fuzziness.
meanings.sent1: The blanket felt nappier after it was washed and dried.
meanings.sent2: The teddy bear's fur was nappier than the smooth fabric of the doll.
meanings.sent3: The cat found a nappier spot to curl up for a nap on the softest pillow.
meanings.sent4: The clouds in the sky looked nappier as the sun began to set, casting a warm glow.
meanings.sent5: The freshly mown grass felt nappier under bare feet, tickling pleasantly.
